docs.title: Aerodyne
docs.text: • Laser Safety Glasses 205 Glass IR, 100-35-205

docs.title: Clean
docs.text:
1. Connect both right and left doors to the slider
  2. Take off glasses: left & top
  3. Take off metal parts (3 components)
    • during installation, place the central one gently at last

docs.title: Sample preparation (carbonate)
docs.text:
• Sample vial: disposable 12 ml borosilicate glass vial (Labco 9RK8)
  • Sample size: 100–200 µg
  • Sequence (16 standards + 50 samples), 96 positions:
    • 8 bypass (last run Carrara Z)
    • Carrara Z × 3, Fletton clay
    • 8 bypass (6 last run Carrara Z, 2 last run Fletton clay)
    • (10 samples, Carrara Z × 2) × 4, 10 samples, Fletton clay, Carrara Z × 3
    • 8 dummies for acid drop
    • 6 acid reservoirs

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Check data (esp. last one) and acid usage
  2. Check flow rate (>80 ml/min) on GasBench (2) to decide measure/re-flush the next batch
  3. Check acid pump (esp. Monday)
    1. Forward
    2. manually click button on acid pump multiple times: should be <4s?? per drop
    3. wipe off acid
    4. consider changing Acid Pump–Calibrate...
  4. Put on dummies/standards/samples
  5. Needle maintenance
    1. magnifier
      • curve is original/smooth
      • hole is clear
    2. use little drill to clean: poke in <1 mm, no need to be too invasive unless last batch:
      • first two peaks are smaller than latter peaks
      • peaks do not gradually decrease one by one
    3. put capillaries behind the arm of auto-sampler and put back needles
  6. Aquisation: choose and edit .seq file
    • usually use Carbonate Acid Measure 50 Extra8.seq (with Acid Drop & Measure.met), if more acid drops are needed for some samples with less TIC, use Carbonate Acid Measure 50 Extra8 diff drops.seq and change method into, for instance, Acid Drop & Measure 12 drops.met for these samples
    • input Identifier 1 for samples, Identifier 2 (weight) for standards
    • Options: update date in the Folder Name and Export File Name
    • Save
  7. Check: Ref CO2 On/Off (esp. Monday)
  8. Start
  9. Check first bypass: peaks should gradually decrease one by one

docs.title: Flush on GasBench (2)
docs.text:
1. Prepare
    • Needle
    • Config: Gasbench+acid
  2. Needle maintenance…
    1. …
    2. …
    3. check flow rate: >80 ml/min
    4. put back needle and press OK
  3. Sequence: CARB FLUSHFILL MISC SINGLE NEEDLE.seq with CARB FLUSHFILL 6min MOD.met (stop Flush Fill at 350 s before pulling out needle)
  4. Check
    • on/off results of the working gas for DIC analysis

docs.title: Acid pump
docs.text:
https://www.fluidmetering.com/how-it-works

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EsaawMQ5JbY

https://www.youtube.com/@fmipump1959/videos

RH0CKC

  • Air in pump:
    1. disconnect the metal tube and manually click button on acid pump
    2. if too much air, do 1 and then pump DI water until it starts to spout, and then pump acid (discard acid after pumping)
  • Clean and change seals
    1. disconnect power
    2. unmount acid tray
    3. …
    4. 3 flimsy seals
      • <<>
    5. 1 rubber O-ring
  • Standby for long time
    • displace acid with DI water

docs.title: Log
docs.text: High Voltage 2.952 kV HV 3.02 kV Box 0.74 mA Trap 0.76 mA Vac (needle valve off) 4.9e-8 Vac (needle valve on) 8.9e-7 On/Off 44, 45, 46 3780, 4470, 5400

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text:
• Reboot auto-sampler:
    • disconnect power cord, reconnect
    • Check positions
      • remove needles
      • Menu > Utilities > F3 > Object Trays > Tray 01
  • Change fan
    • push and pull out/insert the cable
  • Nafion for water removal
  • Replace He (ca. 6 months)
    1. turn off source, needle valve
    2. old cylinder: turn off valve, disconnect, write MT
    3. new cylinder: connect (using a short spanner to prevent over-tightness), 3 bar (>1 bar for regulator in GasBench), leak check, write date
    4. wait 5 mins, turn on needle valve
    5. turn on source
  • Replace filament (#1027920)
    1. turn off: source, needle valve, pumps (on the panel, hear the turbo pump down)
    2. open door by removing 2 screws
    3. unplug 3 cables without damaging the PCB
    4. loose 4 screws
    5. remove 3 screws
    6. press source when loosening the 4th screw to prevent it popping out
    7. replace filament
      1. gloves on
      2. take off 4 screws
      3. half tighten 2 screws, push filament up left, fully tighten 2 screws
      4. insert two leads (+/−) into the slots
      5. press and check the metal connections
      6. check multimeter
    8. monitor high vacuum ( Instrument control)
      • Scan Time: 100000?, Delay: 0.1
      • 1e-6 → <1e-7
    9. turn on pumps (on the panel)
    10. turn on source (needle valve off): high vacuum increases, and then return back
    11. turn off source
    12. turn on needle valve high vacuum ≈1e-6
    13. note down previous sensitivity
    14. Auto focus
    15. save
    16. Pass to gasconfiguration
    17. run CO2 OnOff Sept2014.seq (100 measurements, save in ... CO2 ONOFF)
      • BGD44: 14 → 2.4 mV
      • sensitivity: 4500 → 4100
      • check linearity between different cycles within one measurement (1–10V, step?, ??<0.03‰/V)

docs.title: Version history
docs.text:
• 2024-02-22:
    • Add flow rate check during needle maintenance for flush on GasBench (2)
    • Less invasive clean with a little drill

docs.title: Sample preparation (DIC)
docs.text:
• Sequence:

    • BOTTY × 2, FLORIDA × 2, 10 samples, BOTTY × 2, FLORIDA × 2, …

  • Add acid and flush

    • 4 drops of H3PO4, cap, flush (5h 50min for 12 stds + 20 samples + 2 spares)
    • Tighten cap (with gloves) until septum is slightly indented

  • Standards

    • Standards:
      • BOTTY NaHCO3: δ13CVPDB = −4.22‰
      • FLORIDA KHCO3: δ13CVPDB = −23.91‰
    • Standard concentration:
      • seawater: 20 mg/100ml NaHCO3 or KHCO3
    • Boil ~500 ml (1L beaker) DI water for ~5 min, totally ~25 min (@370 °C hotplate)

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Prepare

    • Needle

    • Config: Gasbench

  2. move each vial so that its cap is at the center of the hole

  3. sort capillary
  4. Run seq
    • seq:
    • method:

docs.title: Log
docs.text: High Voltage 2.984 kV HV 3.04 kV Box 0.61 mA Trap 0.89 mA Vac (needle valve off) e-8 Vac (needle valve on) 1.4 e-6 On/Off 44, 45, 46 2900, 3480, 4100

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample size: µg
  • Sequence:

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Open He cylinder
  2. Turn on carrier gas to 1.0 bar
  3. Leak check for both ends of the reactor
  4. Turn on green button behind EA
  5. Check the fan beside both ends of the reactor
  6. GC column: 90 °C, Reactor: 500 °C (JUMO temperature controller)
    1. press “P” twice to display SP
    2. set temperature
    3. press “P” twice to display current temperature

docs.title: Standby
docs.text:
1. Turn off needle valve (slowly, watch vacuum)
  2. Purge gas: 0
  3. Carrier gas: 0.5 bar (5 PSI)
  4. Reactor: 500 °C
  5. Turn off CO cylinder

docs.title: Refill and change reactor
docs.text: per 100 samples

docs.title: change
docs.text:
1. Turn off source
  2. Turn off needle valve, and Vac drop from xe-6 to xe-8
  3. Reactor: 500 °C
  4. Carrier gas: 0.5 bar (5 PSI)
  5. …

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text: • Conflo III

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Standards:

    • IAEA-600: (C/N = 5, δ13CVPDB = −27.771‰, δ15NAir = +1‰): 400 µg
    • USGS40 (RM 8573, C/N = 5, δ13CVPDB = −26.39‰, δ15NAir = −4.52‰): 800 µg
    • CC31 (Whatman® α-cellulose, δ13CVPDB = −25.54‰, δ18OSMOW = 31.85‰)

  • Sequence:

    • dummy at the end: in case auto-sampler is stuck

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Check
    • He cylinder
    • Total number of analysis, de-ash/change chemicals
    • Vac = xe-6 bar indicating needle valve is on
    • Slider…
    • He flow rate to the auto-sampler: 80–100 ml/min
  2. Work–Enter:
    • Rise temperatures for L reaction, R reduction, O GC
    • ca. 45 min
  3. …
  4. Standby–Enter (temperatures decrease, He flow off)

docs.title: De-ash
docs.text:
per ca. 200 samples

  1. Turn off source
  2. Turn off needle valve (turn knob clockwise ~360°, check: Vac xe-6 → xe-8)
  3. Check:
    • T =
    • gas flow is off (switch on/off by F3)
  4. Deash
    1. unscrew, take out metal insert (by a metal hook), cool down, deash
    2. check depth, refill quartz wool, push in and check depth
    3. put back metal insert
  5. Press F3: gas flow on, leak check
  6. Press F3: gas flow off
  7. ConFlo IV: Sample dilution max (98%)
  8. Turn on needle valve (counterclockwise, check: Vac xe-8 → xe-6)
  9. Turn on source
  10. Write down date and run number in log book

docs.title: Change chemicals
docs.text:
per >1000 samples, can be ~1300

  1. Take out 2 tubes
    1. Turn off source
    2. Turn off needle valve (Check: Vac xe-6 → xe-8)
    3. Press F3: gas flow off
    4. Wear Kevlar gloves
    5. Disconnect top of each tube
    6. Disconnect bottom of each tube
    7. Take out
  2. Prepare news tubes:
    1. Deash metal insert, put into Cr tube
    2. Take out extra quartz wool for better seal
    3. Put on rubber o-ring
  3. Install 2 tubes
    1. Connect top of Cr tube
    2. Connect bottom of each tube
      • metal o-ring–rubber o-ring
    3. Connect top of Cu tube
    4. Press F3: gas flow on, leak check: all 4 connections, Press F3: gas flow off
  4. Change MgCl2 tube for water trap (2 seals: PTFE side facing upwards)
    • Shake, not too tight
    • Press F3: gas flow on, leak check (use paper to protect wires), Press F3: gas flow off
  5. Rest count: Init
  6. ConFlo IV: Sample dilution max (98%)
  7. Turn on needle valve (Check: Vac xe-8 → xe-6)
  8. Turn on source

docs.title: Determine dilution
docs.text:
Do this after changing filament

  1. Check previous sensitivity: ConFlo IV Interface Show Reference Gas Dilution
  2. Ref Dil 0, peak center, Auto focus for CO2
  3. Do the same for N2
  4. Determine Reference Gas Dilution, ~10 min (auto test combinations: shown in ConFlo IV Diagnosis)
  5. Run OnOff

Choose gas:

  1. Gas configuration
  2. Turn on

docs.text: High Voltage 2.973 kV HV 3.03 kV Box 0.70 mA Trap 0.79 mA Vac (needle valve off) ?e-8 Vac (needle valve on) 1.5e-6 On/Off 44, 45, 46 ,,

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text:
• Config
    • disable remote control: Abort–Enter
    • enable remote control after all lights are green (indicating temperature for L, R, O reach set values)

docs.title: General Guide
docs.text: • Be careful with high vacuum pump, source, reference gas

docs.title: Check when passing by
docs.text:
• SIRA
    • Logs on the screen
    • Ion gauge: sample ≈ reference gas (diff < 0.2)
    • Trace on paper
      • jigsaw upper trace (δ45CO2): contamination by air (introducing C)
      • jigsaw lower trace (δ46CO2): contamination by water (introducing O)
    • Water trap:
      • ice on the pipeline
      • 2 lights on
    • Leak
  • Kiel IV
  • GasBench (1)
    • Peaks gradually decrease
    • Small peaks between main peaks are not too obvious
    • No missing peaks
    • Needles, esp. acid
    • Std δ values
  • GasBench (2)
    • He flow rate
    • δ13C mean ~0, SD ~0.02

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: disposable 0.75 ml borosilicate glass vial (Kimble 60831D-830) (put into reusable Kiel’s septum-free reusable borosilicate vial)
  • Sample size: 20–100 µg
  • Sequence
    • Line 1 & Line 2 (standards 12 + samples 30): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3
    • Line 1 only (standards 8 + samples 15): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 15 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Monday: reboot computer

    • icon on the taskbar: Shutdown (may be grey)
    • reboot computer
    • Kiel IV Carbonate: Turn on “Oven control” & check JUMO temperature controller light on the Front Panel

  2. Acid drop test

  3. LN2

    1. Take off blue LN2 bucket

    2. Check LN2 cylinder

      • 15 samples & 8 standards: consumes ~15%
      • 30 samples & 12 standards: consumes ~25%

    3. Moving

      • pressure inside vessel < 50% of the relief valve level
      • relief valve orientated away from face

    4. Change LN2 cylinder

      1. disconnect electric cable of the cryogenic solenoid valve (ASCO SCE263-205LT)
      2. disconnect Teflon hose (small nut)
        • !! hold the neighbouring male thread stud with a spanner to prevent from loosening or over-tightening
      3. disconnect cryogenic solenoid valve (big nut)
      4. connect: seal big nut with PTFE film, 3 times
      5. fully open outlet valve on LN2 cylinder, and then turn it back one full rotation

  4. Grease Kiel’s vials, insert disposable vials into Kiel’s vials

  5. Clear acid pump

    1. Acquisition – Kiel IV Carbonate: right Take magazine, until Ready...
    2. wipe off acid
    3. stick paper into the circular space around the needles to clean
    4. Monday: take off O-ring, clean, check, (replace), grease
    5. check alignment of needle and sensor
    6. load empties/standards/samples
      • pos 1 for line 1, 2: empty vial
      • pos 2 for line 2: empty vial when using line 1 only sequence
    7. Kiel IV Carbonate: right Load magazine

  6. Check JUMO temperature controller

  7. Edit sequence in Acquisition (CO2_KielIV_Godwin_*.seq)

    1. input Identifier 1 for samples, Weight for standards
    2. Options: update date in the Folder Name and Export File Name
    3. Save
    4. Put on a dry blue LN2 bucket
    5. Start

  8. Method (CO2_KielIV_Godwin.met)

    • Refill Time: increase, when? how much?

docs.title: Log
docs.text: High Voltage 9.502 kV HV ~9.5 kV Box 0.83 mA Trap 0.67 mA Vac (needle valve off) xe-8 Vac (needle valve on) 1.3e-7 FV 2.6e-6

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text:
• Idle: fill pos 1, 2 of line 1, 2 with empty vials
  • Check ref gas refill
    1. set bellow to 100
    2. pump away
    3. 10 s …

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sequence
    • Use only position 1–24
    • 20 measurements/block, 5 blocks/run

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Open gas ballast on 3 pumps for 10 mins
  2. Restart software
  3. Check:
    1. N2 cylinder
    2. 4 LN2 pipes sucking
    3. 3 LN2 tube connections to cold fingers
    4. LN2 refill
    5. No water in compressed air
    6. ? Acid
  4. Change Viton™ vial seal & clean acid

  5. Pump sample & reference side

  6. Refill acid syringe

  7. Ad-trap: 35°C

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
1. Check liquid quantity 1.5 ml
  2. Loosen lids
  3. Fill standards (no bubbles!), mark them
    1. DY-2
    2. BOTTY
    3. SPIT

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text:
1. Check N2 cylinder ( bar)

  2. Autosampler

    1. Change septa
    2. Chg syringe
      1. solvent
      2. rinse
      3. Swap done

  3. Run list folder

  4. Coordinator

    • O17 high precision
    • Load sample list

  5. Monitor

    • H2O ppm
    • Outlet valve

docs.title: Sample preparation
docs.text:
• Sample vial: reusable 1 ml borosilicate glass vial (WHEATON W986284NG) + black cap + blue septa (Analytical Columns C234115)
  • Sample size: 100–150 µg
  • Sequence (standards 12 + samples 30): Carrara Z × 3, Atlantis II, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Carrara Z × 2, 10 samples, Atlantis II, Carrara Z × 3
graph TD
1((01)) --> 5((05))
6((06)) --> 10((10))
11((11)) --> 15((15))
16((16)) --> 20((20))
21((21)) --> 25((25))
26((26)) --> 30((30))
31((31)) --> 35((35))
36((36)) --> 40((40))
41((41)) --> 42((42))

docs.title: Monday
docs.text:
1. Prep–Water Trap Chiller On
  2. AC, ML, MH
  3. Test acid drop
    1. Put tissue under needle
    2. Prep–Dispense Acid
    3. Check acid drop after ~5 mins. If not, repeat the last step.
    4. Redo 2 & 3
  4. 45–60 mins

docs.title: Monday to Thursday
docs.text:
1. Check & prepare
    1. Log on the screen: Finished Autorun
    2. Log paper
    3. Short press LF/FF button several times to feed paper forward until 4–5 holes are out
    4. Remove LN2 tubes from dewar
    5. Check 2 LN2 tube connections to cold fingers
    6. Put lids on samples
  2. Flush sample needle with He gas
    1. Prep–Move Gilson To Next Vial. If Gilson does not move: Prep–Initialise Gilson, then try again.
    2. AB, MH
    3. Check: AD
    4. AE
    5. Connect He gas, open cylinder valve, open regulator valve (<2 bar)
    6. Wipe off acid
    7. Check flow rate through the needle
    8. Disonnect He gas
  3. Pump out sample side
    1. Put on an old vial on needle: holes inside the vial & DO NOT touch the acid
    2. ML, AD, until ML vac ≈ 1.0e-3 (take out old sample vials in the heater block)
    3. Prep–Initialise Gilson
    4. Remove old vial
    5. AB, ML
    6. MH (auto ML)
  4. Refill reference gas
    1. Set reference gas bellow to 3100 (Stage 2)
    2. LV, RP, RV, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3 (Put new sample vials into the heater block)
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O Valve, until 44 < 4e-11
    4. RM
    5. Check SP
    6. RI
    7. Manually operate 2 toggle valves (U: upper, L: lower) on reference gas cylinder
      1. L: pump out reference gas between the two valves 30s
      2. LV
      3. RP (Stage 2)
      4. L, U: release reference gas into the space between L and U 30s
      5. U, L: refill reference gas 30s (edit batch MPRPCM)
      6. L
    8. Measure reference gas
      1. RI, RP
      2. Set reference gas bellow to 0, until bellow fully open
      3. RM
      4. Check 44 ≈ 2.5e-9
      5. Test–Peak Center, close scan
  5. Edit batch MPRPCM
    1. Analysis–Autorun Batch Edit–select MPRPCM from the list
    2. MPRPCM: Setup
    3. Release all
    4. Enter new sample numbers, then OK–OK
  6. Reboot by Ctrl+Alt+Del
  7. Fill LN2 dewar
    • wear PPE
    • efficient transfer is achieved at 5–10 psi
    • filled to 90% of their net capacity to reduce the risk of spillage
    • 20L, record on the notebook
    • Check two tubes before putting them into the LN2 dewar: ~2 cm from the end of the wood stick
  8. Analysis–Autorun Start/Stop–select MPRPCM from the list, Run

docs.title: Friday Standby
docs.text:
1. Check status: Finished Autorun
  2. Remove LN2 tubes from dewar
  3. Prep–Water Trap Chiller Off
  4. ML, AB (check: AC)
  5. LV, RP, RF, RV, RM, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    • optional: Set reference gas bellow to 3100 (Stage 2); RI, pump out, and then RI
  6. HV

docs.title: CO<sub>2</sub> from organic matter
docs.text:
1. Connect organic reference gas cylinder

    1. HV
    2. RP, RF, check RI
    3. Disconnect Carrara Z reference gas cylinder
    4. Connect organic reference gas cylinder

  2. Fill organic reference gas

    1. Set reference gas bellow to 1000
    2. Check SP
    3. LV, RP, RF, RV, RM until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    4. Inlet–Toggle C/O Valve, until Mass-44 < 4e-11 A
    5. RM
    6. RI
    7. Manually operate 2 toggle valves (U: upper, L: lower) on organic reference gas cylinder
      1. L: pump out reference gas between two valves 30s
      2. L, U: release reference gas into the space between L and U 30s
      3. LV
      4. RP
      5. U, L: refill reference gas 30s
      6. L
  3. Check system status by measuring organic reference gas
    1. RI, RF (so that space between RF and SC can be used for sample gas later)
    2. RM
    3. Tune reference gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ Mass-44 ≈ 6e-9
    4. Test–Peak Center, close scan
    5. RV
    6. Disable changeover ( Inlet-)
    7. Manually analyse against reference gas itself (DACP–CO2, Sample name: ORG GAS REF ZERO). Can do 4.
    8. !!! After run: Enable changeover

  4. Connect sample tube (during run for last sample/reference gas)

    1. Check RI
    2. Disconnect organic reference gas cylinder or last sample tube
    3. Cut glass sample tube, insert into metal tube (from the simple end)
    4. Connect (the more complicated end with a filter) to reference gas inlet
    5. LV, RI, RP, SP (space between RF and SF)

  5. Fill sample gas (after run for last sample/reference gas)

    1. Set sample gas bellow to 0
    2. LV, RI, RP, SP, SF, SV, SM (space between RF and SC) until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O Valve, until Mass-44 < 4e-11 A
    4. LV
    5. Break sample tube, until Mass-44 is stable
  6. Measure sample gas
    1. RI, SF (store sample gas in between)
    2. Tune sample gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ Mass-44 ≈ 6e-9, record the value
    3. Inlet–Toggle C/O Valve, tune reference gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ Mass-44 sample − reference ≈ 0.08
    4. Inlet–Toggle C/O Valve, tune sample gas bellow (squeeze, larger value) ⟹ Mass-44 sample − reference ≈ 0.08
    5. RV, SV
    6. Manually analyse (DACP–CO2, Sample name: …)
    7. Can do 4 when the analysis for current sample gas appears to be OK
  7. Repeat 4–6
  8. Standby 1. (Check RI) Connect Carrara Z reference gas cylinder 2. Changeover → waste 3. Set both bellows to 0 4. Pump all that is left of SI: LV, RI…, until LV vac ≈ 1.0e-3 5. RI 6. HV

docs.title: Misc.
docs.text:
• Cold fingers: click stop before clicking heat/cool
  • Scan config for OCR : 600 dpi, Gray scale, TIFF
  • Replenish reference gas:
    • Stage 1: RP, gradually decrease reference gas bellow (increase bellow size) through time
      • until 2024-01-23: 1400
    • Stage 2: RP, gradually decrease reference gas bellow (increase bellow size) through time
      • after 2024-01-23: 3100
  • Error 1051 is OK

docs.title: Solenoid valve can not be turned on/off
docs.text:
Symptoms:

  • Error: Too many small samples
  • Cannot pump out gas

Solution:

  1. Turn off pumps, test valves
  2. Change solenoid

docs.title: Solenoid valve leak
docs.text:
Symptom: hear the leak

Solution: change (3) valve seals

docs.title: Stuck during run
docs.text: Solution: reboot computer connected directly to SIRA, and then reboot computer with GUI

docs.title: Data quality control
docs.text: • Ion Gauge for Sample and Reference are similar, difference < 0.2e-8

docs.title: Version history
docs.text:
• 2024-01-11: Compiled by Xi (Sean) Chen, based on notes and tuition from James Rolfe
  • 2024-02-17: Add CO2 from organic matter

docs.title: Foraminifera cleaning
docs.text:
1. Dry in oven
  2. Crush
  3. 1 drop 3% H2O2 (dilute from 30%), tap and get rid of bubbles, ~30 min
  4. 1 drop AG acetone, supersonic
  5. Drain with Kimwipes roll
  6. Dry in oven

docs.title: Version history
docs.text: • 2024-02-11: Compiled by Xi (Sean) Chen, based on tuition from Maryline Jeanne Vautravers.

docs.title: Sieving
docs.text:
Sieving Expedition 397 U1385 samples. Work in stratigraphic sequence.

  1. Disaggregation
    1. Take samples from a big plastic bag and sort them into cardboard boxes
    2. Take out samples according to labels prepared by Simon, put other samples into 2 mid-size plastic bags and then put back into the original big plastic bag
    3. Label (A, plastic, small) wide neck 250 ml conical flask
      • Put Label (A) on white electrical tape, and then put white electrical tape onto flask, so that Label (A, together with electrical tape) can be easily detached later
    4. Place flask onto the scale, tare
    5. Break samples into >3 parts and put into flask, weight of bulk sample
      • Keep a small piece of spare sample in the original plastic bag and seal with a heat sealer
    6. Add ~100 ml de-ionised (DI) water (almost, but do not fully submerge sample)
    7. Put on orange rubber bung
      • Simon & Jeannie: marked with a blue dot
      • DO NOT push down
    8. Put onto orbital shaker set at close to 200 rotations
      1. After 10 minutes, check subsamples are moving (detached from base) in beaker. If a lump is “stuck”, usually in the middle, try to move it to the side. Adjust speed as needed — different samples have different lowest working speeds.
      2. Leave for <4–5 hours. Shorter period is preferable, as long as samples reach a soupy slurry state. Higher rotations or longer period may crush or damage tests, esp. when there are big pyrites.
  2. Sieve
    1. Label (B, paper, big) plastic resealable bag
    2. write weight of resealable bag onto itself
      • Put a tape roll as a holder onto the balance
    3. Open resealable bag and put into 1000 mL (reusable) beaker
    4. Move Label (A) on flask to sieve
    5. Put 150 µm mesh ⌀100 mm stainless steel sieve on top of beaker
    6. Washout soupy slurry in flask with DI water, use higher flow rate (loosen spray nozzle)
    7. Sieve with DI water, use lower flow rate, i.e., fine aerosol (tighten spray nozzle)
      • may need one additional 1000 ml CLEAN beaker for fine fraction when there are big lumps
    8. Put flasks onto trolley for later wash by glassware washer
  3. Coarse fraction (foraminifera) on sieve:
    1. Put into oven at 40 °C, >1 hour until completely dry
    2. Take off Label (A) on sieve, trim it with a scissor, and then put it onto glass vial as a backup
    3. Label (C, plastic, small) glass vial
    4. Clean up triangle cardboard holder & metal funnel with brush
    5. Put triangle cardboard holder on to the scale
    6. Transfer coarse fraction from sieve to cardboard holder with two hard brushes (one made from tooth brush, mainly brush underneath the sieve; another No. 10 flat brush, brush inside the sieve and for transfer). dry weight
    7. Transfer into glass vial with a metal funnel and a soft round No.4 brush
    8. Write sample info on the cap of glass vial
  4. Fine fraction (coccoliths, nannofossils, etc.) in resealable bag (in beaker):
    1. Settle, 3 or 4 days until liquid is clear
    2. Drain by pump as much as possible, without disturbing fine particles
    3. Optional: transfer the portion from the additional beaker to the resealable bag (rinse and transfer), settle–drain
    4. Dry in 50 °C oven
    5. Sort on a desk
    6. dry weight and weight of resealable bag
      • Put a tape roll as a holder onto the balance
    7. Put into a big bag
      • Gather samples from the same section into one big plastic resealable bag
    8. Google spreadsheet: SedLab Copy of U1385 CSF-A and CCSF depths for BCR samples

docs.title: Notes
docs.text:
• Samples are prepared in order, starting from the top of a core and working downwards. This minimises any errors with labelling through out the whole process.
  • In some cases sieve may need to be sonicated a few seconds to remove the coarse fraction trapped in the mesh.
  • Contents of water and coarse fraction can be calculated from recorded weights.

docs.title: Version history
docs.text: • 2024-03-11: Compiled by Xi (Sean) Chen, based on notes and tuition from Simon J. Crowhurst, Maryline Jeanne Vautravers, James Rolfe, and Jeannie F. Booth.
